casebody.data:
CARDIORENTIS AG
v.
IQVIA LTD. and Iqvia RDS, Inc. 168A19-1 Supreme Court of North Carolina. August 15, 2019 J. Dickson Phillips, III, Attorney at Law, for Cardiorentis AG. Charles F. Marshall, III, Attorney at Law, for Iqvia Ltd. and Iqvia RDS, Inc. Jonathan C. Krisko, Attorney at Law, Charlotte, for Cardiorentis AG. Shepard D. O'Connell, Attorney at Law, Greensboro, for Iqvia Ltd. and Iqvia RDS, Inc. Catherine E. Stetson, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for Cardiorentis AG. Kyle M. Druding, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for Cardiorentis AG. Michael J. Klisch, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for Iqvia Ltd. and Iqvia RDS, Inc. Joshua M. Siegel, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for Iqvia Ltd. and Iqvia RDS, Inc. Robert T. Cahill, Attorney at Law, Pro Hac Vice, for Iqvia Ltd. and Iqvia RDS, Inc.

The following order has been entered on the Motion for Extension of Time to File Reply Brief filed on the 15th of August 2019 by Plaintiff:

"Motion Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 15th of August 2019."

Plaintiff shall have up to and including the 9th day of September 2019 to file and serve his/her brief with this Court.
